basics.name: Michael D'Angelo
basics.label: Co-founder & CTO
basics.summary: Hi, I'm Michael. I'm the co-founder and CTO of Promptfoo (YC S24), where we make software security and reliability tools for LLM developers used by 125,000+ developers. We recently announced our $5 million seed round. Before Promptfoo, I was the VP of Engineering at SmileID (YC W19), where I scaled our engineering team to build a world-leading product in identity verification. We focused on Africa, and we grew from 0 to 10 million verifications and 170 million users. In 2016, I co-founded Arthena (YC S17), where I was CEO. Arthena quantified and securitized art, and I ran platform development, business development, and fundraising. We became the number one art investment platform globally and were featured in many publications. Our collectors have done very well with their collections, with appraised values over $1.5 billion. On the side, I angel invest. I've made about 100 small pre-seed investments via Skeptical Investments. I've averaged ~3x (as of mid-2024), with much of the portfolio still outstanding. Some well-known investments include: Varda Space Industries, Airhart Aeronautics, Rewind. I've found my engineering background to be particularly helpful when investing in hard tech. I like to run, ski, and take photos in my spare time.

work.name: Promptfoo
work.summary: Promptfoo makes testing and security tools for developers of LLM applications. It's used by over 25,000 developers, including 35% of the Fortune 500.
highlights: Raised $5 million seed round from Andreessen Horowitz

work.name: Smile Identity
work.summary: Smile Identity provides identity verification, KYC compliance, and onboarding across the African continent. YC W19.
highlights: Scaled engineering team from 6 to 27 engineers
Grew from 0 to 10 million identity verifications and 170 million users
Led re-architecture that improved matching accuracy by 50%
Reduced infrastructure costs by 80% through optimization

work.name: Skeptical Investments
work.summary: Skeptical Investments is a micro-vc fund with ~100 pre-seed investments.
highlights: Notable investments: Varda Space Industries, Airhart Aeronautics, Rewind

work.name: Arthena
work.summary: Arthena is a quantitative investment fund specializing in art. YC S17.
highlights: Managed collections with appraised values over $1.5 billion

work.name: Matroid
work.summary: Matroid is a computer vision platform that helps people build and deploy visual detection models.

work.name: Planet
work.summary: Planet is the leading provider of global, daily satellite imagery and insights.

work.name: Facebook
work.summary: Worked on the web performance team.

work.name: UB Nanosatellite Program
work.summary: Developed and implemented the power subsystem and actively contributed to the development and testing of the communications, thermal, and command and data handling subsystems for GLADOS, a 3U CubeSat.

courses: Convolutional Neural Networks for Visual Recognition (CS 231n)
Natural Language Processing with Deep Learning (CS 224d)
Numerical Solution of Partial Differential Equations (CME 306)
Theory and Applications of Stochastic Differential Equations (CME 308)
Computer Graphics in the Era of AI (CS 348C)
